texto: Illegal logging continues to threaten the Amazonâ€™s rich biodiversity, local communities, and economic stability. But thereâ€™s a powerful shift underway.The Forest Fingerprints project, supported in part byThe Nature Conservancy Brasil, is harnessing the power of chemical analysis, AI, and machine learning to trace the true origin of timber. In one study, researchers analyzed 67 trees across 21 sites using strontium isotopes, uncovering a strong connection between wood chemistry and local geology. This breakthrough could help verify timber sources and support more transparent, sustainable forest management.While more data is needed to refine the method, this innovative approach offers real promise for protecting the Amazon and ensuring its resources are used legally and responsibly.Science is giving forests a voice. texto: Saludos a todos,A continuaciÃ³n, informaciÃ³n para descargar el nuevo paper publicado:WeldVGG: A VGG-Inspired Deep Learning Model for Weld Defect Classification from Radiographic Images with Visual InterpretabilityAuthors:Gabriel LÃ³pez 1,Pablo Duque RamÃ­rez 2,*, Emanuel Vega 1, Felix Pizarro 2, Joaquin Toro 1 and Carlos Parra 2Link para descargar  el paper:https://lnkd.in/eMsdHZAehttps://lnkd.in/edYsE9TH1 Escuela de IngenierÃ­a InformÃ¡tica, Pontificia Universidad CatÃ³lica de ValparaÃ­so (PUCV), Av. Brasil 2241, ValparaÃ­so 2362807, Chile2 Departamento de MecÃ¡nica, Universidad TÃ©cnica Federico Santa MarÃ­a, Av. Federico Sta. MarÃ­a 6090, ViÃ±a del Mar 2520000, ChileSensors 2025, 25(19), 6183;https://lnkd.in/eyJgg6XbThis research was funded by: UNIVERSIDAD TÃ‰CNICA FEDERICO SANTA MARÃA. PROYECTO DE INNOVACIÃ“N-03-2025. Departamento de MecÃ¡nica.AbstractVisual inspection remains a cornerstone of quality control in welded structures, yet manual evaluations are inherently constrained by subjectivity, inconsistency, and limited scalability. This study presents WeldVGG, a deep learning-based visual inspection model designed to automate weld defect classification using radiographic imagery. The proposed model is trained on the RIAWELC dataset, a publicly available collection of X-ray weld images acquired in real manufacturing environments and annotated across four defect conditions: cracking, porosity, lack of penetration, and no defect. RIAWELC offers high-resolution imagery and standardized class labels, making it a valuable benchmark for defect classification under realistic conditions. To improve trust and explainability, Grad-CAM++ is employed to generate class-discriminative saliency maps, enabling visual validation of predictions. The model is rigorously evaluated through stratified cross-validation and benchmarked against traditional machine learning baselines, including SVC, Random Forest, and a state-of-the-art architecture, MobileNetV3. The proposed model achieves high classification accuracy and interpretability, offering a practical and scalable solution for intelligent weld inspection.........Keywords: weld inspection; radiographic inspection; convolutional neural network; visual testing; industrial AI; Grad-CAM++; interpretability; weld defect classification

Departamento de MecÃ¡nica.AbstractVisual inspection remains a cornerstone of quality control in welded structures, yet manual evaluations are inherently constrained by subjectivity, inconsistency, and limited scalability. This study presents WeldVGG, a deep learning-based visual inspection model designed to automate weld defect classification using radiographic imagery. The proposed model is trained on the RIAWELC dataset, a publicly available collection of X-ray weld images acquired in real manufacturing environments and annotated across four defect conditions: cracking, porosity, lack of penetration, and no defect. RIAWELC offers high-resolution imagery and standardized class labels, making it a valuable benchmark for defect classification under realistic conditions. To improve trust and explainability, Grad-CAM++ is employed to generate class-discriminative saliency maps, enabling visual validation of predictions. The model is rigorously evaluated through stratified cross-validation and benchmarked against traditional machine learning baselines, including SVC, Random Forest, and a state-of-the-art architecture, MobileNetV3. The proposed model achieves high classification accuracy and interpretability, offering a practical and scalable solution for intelligent weld inspection.........Keywords: weld inspection; radiographic inspection; convolutional neural network; visual testing; industrial AI; Grad-CAM++; interpretability; weld defect classification

texto: Beyond Tools, Toward Power Structures: A Critical Review of AI in Primary EducationArtificial Intelligence is rapidly entering primary education, often framed as a neutral or purely technical innovation. But what happens when we look beyond the tools â€”and examine AI as a power structure?In this article, we (Ana Yara Postigo Fuentes,Amaia Arroyo Sagasta, PhDand myself ) critically review 23 primary studies on AI in primary education using the framework â€œDimensions for Analysing AIâ€™s Impact on Educationâ€ (CastaÃ±eda et al., forthcoming hopefully this year). This multidimensional lens â€”instrumental, epistemological, ethical, social, political, commercial, and ideologicalâ€” helps us reveal what current research highlights, and what it systematically overlooks.The results show strong imbalances: instrumental, ethical, and social dimensions dominate the field, while commercial and ideological ones remain marginal. AI continues to be portrayed as a technical fix with moral overtones rather than a complex socio-political actor shaping classrooms, policies, and markets.We argue for a more integrated, critically informed collaboration among educators, families, researchers, industry, and policymakersâ€”so that AI serves educational justice and democratic participation, instead of reinforcing existing inequalities.The article is available in English only:https://lnkd.in/dPMrF7iW______________________Entre las herramientas y las estructuras de poder: una revisiÃ³n crÃ­tica de la inteligencia artificial en la educaciÃ³n primariaLa inteligencia artificial estÃ¡ entrando en la educaciÃ³n primaria envuelta en promesas de innovaciÃ³n y eficiencia. Este enfoque multidimensional â€”instrumental, epistemolÃ³gico, Ã©tico, social, polÃ­tico, comercial e ideolÃ³gicoâ€” permite observar no solo quÃ© aspectos destaca la literatura actual, sino tambiÃ©n quÃ© deja sistemÃ¡ticamente fuera.Los resultados muestran un claro desequilibrio: las dimensiones instrumental, Ã©tica y social son las mÃ¡s tratadas, mientras que las comercial e ideolÃ³gica apenas aparecen. La IA sigue viÃ©ndose como una soluciÃ³n tÃ©cnica con tintes morales, mÃ¡s que como un actor socio-polÃ­tico que configura aulas, polÃ­ticas y mercados.Defendemos una colaboraciÃ³n mÃ¡s integrada y crÃ­ticamente informada entre docentes, familias, investigadores, industria y responsables polÃ­ticos, para que la IA contribuya a la justicia educativa y la participaciÃ³n democrÃ¡tica, en lugar de profundizar las desigualdades existentes.

texto: UNESCOâ€™s latest report, "Open Data for AI â€“ What Now?", revisits the Pandemic to remind us that open data is an ethical imperative.Behind every responsible AI model lies a foundation of FAIR data (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable).But the report goes further: it outlines a three-phase journey that any nation and any organization can follow to make data openness a living practice:1ï¸âƒ£ PrepareBuild capacity and policies for high-quality, AI-ready data.2ï¸âƒ£ OpenRelease datasets responsibly legally, technically, and culturally.3ï¸âƒ£ Follow upSustain engagement, trust, and long-term reuse.This isnâ€™t about data infrastructure alone. We cannot keep our eyes only on the technology standpoint.ğŸ‘‰ This is about cultivating a culture of openness, where sharing knowledge becomes an act of collective intelligence. ğŸ‘ˆWithout open data, AI remains a mirror of our silos.But with it, we have the chance to build systems that reflect our best values of transparency, inclusion, and accountability.What will be your next movement?I'm reading your comments!--Durante la pandemia aprendimos una lecciÃ³n que va mucho mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de la salud pÃºblica: el conocimiento compartido salva vidas.El Ãºltimo informe de laUNESCOsobre Open Data e IA retoma esa idea con una invitaciÃ³n clara: construir una cultura global de apertura, confianza y cooperaciÃ³n basada en datos FAIR (Findables, Accesibles, Interoperables y Reutilizables).Sin datos abiertos no hay IA responsable.Y sin IA responsable, no hay transformaciÃ³n digital sostenible.El informe propone una hoja de ruta en tres fases para cualquier organizaciÃ³n que aspire a una inteligencia verdaderamente Ã©tica y humana:1ï¸âƒ£ Preparar polÃ­ticas y capacidades para datos de calidad y listos para IA.2ï¸âƒ£ Abrir con transparencia tÃ©cnica y legal, fomentando una cultura de colaboraciÃ³n.3ï¸âƒ£ Dar seguimiento garantizando reutilizaciÃ³n, participaciÃ³n ciudadana y sostenibilidad.El reto no es tÃ©cnico, es cultural.ğŸ‘‰ El futuro de la inteligencia, humana o artificial, dependerÃ¡ de nuestra capacidad para compartir, comprender y cuidar los datos que la alimentan. ğŸ‘ˆY tÃº, Â¿quÃ© vas a hacer al respecto?Â¡Te leo en comentarios!

texto: (EN) Artificial intelligence has made many processes more efficient. However, in professional translation, speed is only valuable when meaning remains intact.An automatic draft may resolve general terminology, but it does not always interpret what sustains the document: an obligation in a contract, a parameter in a technical sheet or a nuance that shapes a decision.At Tradulingua, AI is a useful tool, not a guarantee. Precision comes from human review: analysing context, intent and specialised terminology to confirm the actual function of each part of the text.Technology provides efficiency. Professional judgment provides meaning. The combination works when the final reading is done by someone who understands the language, the field and the implications of each choice.

texto: ğŸ•– The Seven Super Powers of Futurists ğŸ¦¸â€â™€ï¸. Sohail Inayatullah. Journal of Futures Studiesâ• Cuando el maÃ±ana es igual que hoy, puede producirse aburrimiento. Buscamos novedad. Sin embargo, en esta fase de la historia de la humanidad, el maÃ±ana ciertamente no serÃ¡ como hoy. De hecho, estamos en medio de un dramÃ¡tico cambio social y tecnolÃ³gico. Esto incluye:â• 1) Un cambio demogrÃ¡fico en Ãfrica tal que en 2050 el 40% de todos los niÃ±os del mundo vivirÃ¡n en Ãfrica[i]Â y para el aÃ±o 2100, el 39% de todos los adultos del mundo vivirÃ¡n en Ãfrica.[ii][iii]â•  2) SubpoblaciÃ³nÂ [iv]en muchas naciones de Asia occidental y oriental,[v]Â creando escasez de mano de obra y la posibilidad de una economÃ­a de estado estable.â•  3) El auge de nuevas tecnologÃ­as como la impresiÃ³n 3D, los drones, la inteligencia artificial, los coches sin conductor aumentan drÃ¡sticamente la productividad, reducen costes y, entre otros impactos, reconocen el diseÃ±o urbano (Â¿por quÃ© plazas de aparcamiento? Â¿o por quÃ© no los coches como casas mÃ³viles?).4) La probable disrupciÃ³n importante en la industria alimentaria mundial a travÃ©s de la agricultura celular â€“ la nueva carne pura y leche pura y el fin de la cadena de suministro de alimentos de origen animal, la posibilidad de un cambio narrativo de los mataderos a los invernaderos y laboratorios de alimentos.Â [vi]5.(...)ğŸ¦¸â€â™€ï¸ To conclude, in times of dramatic change, we donâ€™t simply need better maps of the changing world, we need special powers or super powers to avoid the futures we donâ€™t want and create the futures we do. We need the super power of:(1) Being able to stay calm and focused through meditation;(2) We need the power to learn and reflect instead of acting from unchallenged assumptions and past behavior.(3) We need the superpower to challenge the used future â€“ what we have been doing but no longer works.(4) We need the ability to understand how the world is changing, and the impacts of these disruptions on our day to day life and strategy.(5) We need the superpower to understand and create alternative futures instead of being fixated on one view: one future. This means letting go of the train-track worldview.(6) We need the super-power of narrative, of telling a different story about our lives. And, finally,(7) We need to link story to systemic change, creating a virtuous cycle of change, ensuring that what we value, we count.ğŸ”— en primer comentario

texto: ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¸ Â¿Tienen impacto los ritmos circadianos en la fertilidad? Cronofertilidad.Un estudio reciente destaca la importancia de los ritmos biolÃ³gicos en varias escalas temporales circadianos (24 horas), infradianos (mÃ¡s de 24 horas) y ultradianos (menos de 24 horas) sobre la funciÃ³n reproductiva humana.ğŸ“Š Datos clave del estudio:â¡La edad media de las mujeres estudiadas fue 32.8 aÃ±os.â¡Se observÃ³ que la sincronizaciÃ³n de los relojes biolÃ³gicos en ovarios y Ãºtero es crucial para la ovulaciÃ³n, calidad ovocitaria y receptividad endometrial.â¡Modelos predictivos basados en inteligencia artificial muestran un Ã¡rea bajo la curva ROC de hasta 0.76 para predicciÃ³n de implantaciÃ³n embrionaria, considerando factores cronobiolÃ³gicos entre otros.â¡Alteraciones en los ritmos biolÃ³gicos, como las producidas por trabajo nocturno o exposiciÃ³n a luz artificial, se asocian a menor Ã©xito reproductivo.â¡La cronobiologÃ­a multi-escala ayuda a entender la heterogeneidad individual y mejora las estrategias personalizadas en reproducciÃ³n asistida.ğŸ’¡ ConclusiÃ³n:Integrar la cronobiologÃ­a en la prÃ¡ctica clÃ­nica y la investigaciÃ³n representa una estrategia innovadora que podrÃ­a transformar el manejo de la infertilidad, optimizando tiempos y tratamientos basados en los ritmos biolÃ³gicos individuales.ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ Do circadian rhythms impact fertility? Chronofertility.A recent study highlights the importance of biological rhythms across multiple timescales â€” circadian (24 hours), infradian (more than 24 hours), and ultradian (less than 24 hours) â€” on human reproductive function.ğŸ“Š Key study data:â¡The average age of women studied was 32.8 years.â¡Synchronization of biological clocks in ovaries and uterus is crucial for ovulation, oocyte quality, and endometrial receptivity.â¡Predictive models based on artificial intelligence show an area under the ROC curve up to 0.76 for embryo implantation prediction, considering chronobiological factors among others.â¡Disruptions in biological rhythms, such as those caused by night shift work or artificial light exposure, are associated with lower reproductive success.â¡Multi-scale chronobiology helps understand individual heterogeneity and improves personalized strategies in assisted reproduction.ğŸ’¡ Conclusion:Integrating chronobiology into clinical practice and research represents an innovative strategy that could transform infertility management, optimizing timing and treatments based on individual biological rhythms.

texto: ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¸ ActualizaciÃ³n GOLD 2026 â€” Principales NovedadesLa nueva versiÃ³n de la GOLD 2026 introduce cambios relevantes en el diagnÃ³stico y manejo de la EPOC. Entre los aspectos mÃ¡s destacados:â€¢ Nueva clasificaciÃ³n fisiolÃ³gica de las exacerbaciones (ROME) incorporando PCR, gasometrÃ­a (PaOâ‚‚, PaCOâ‚‚ con rangos especÃ­ficos), acidosis y escala VAS de disnea.â€¢ Mayor peso de los eosinÃ³filos para decidir tratamiento:â€“ ICS solo si â‰¥100 cÃ©l/ÂµLâ€“ Triple terapia principalmente si â‰¥300 cÃ©l/ÂµLâ€“ Si eos <100, se prioriza azitromicina o roflumilast antes que triple terapia.â€¢ N-acetilcisteÃ­na gana un papel relevante como coadyuvante durante la exacerbaciÃ³n, mejorando sÃ­ntomas e inflamaciÃ³n.â€¢ Nuevo concepto de â€œactividad de la enfermedadâ€, que integra inflamaciÃ³n, exacerbaciones y progresiÃ³n funcional como objetivo terapÃ©utico.â€¢ BiolÃ³gicos, como dupilumab, entran por primera vez en el algoritmo.â€¢ Se incorpora un nuevo capÃ­tulo dedicado a Inteligencia Artificial y tecnologÃ­as emergentes, incluyendo IA para diagnÃ³stico, estratificaciÃ³n de riesgo, anÃ¡lisis de imagen, seguimiento remoto y modelos predictivos.â€¢ Se mantiene el punto de corte FEV1/FVC < 0.70 para diagnÃ³stico, sin adoptar LLN/z-score.Una actualizaciÃ³n que refuerza la personalizaciÃ³n del tratamiento y la integraciÃ³n de biomarcadores, fisiologÃ­a, tecnologÃ­as avanzadas y prevenciÃ³n en el manejo de la EPOC.Estos cambios plantean retos y oportunidades en nuestra prÃ¡ctica clÃ­nica. Â¿CuÃ¡l crees que serÃ¡ el mayor desafÃ­o en su implementaciÃ³n?---ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ GOLD 2026 Update â€” Key HighlightsThe new GOLD 2026 version introduces important updates in COPD diagnosis and management. Key highlights include:â€¢ New physiological ROME classification for exacerbations, incorporating CRP, blood gases (PaOâ‚‚, PaCOâ‚‚ with specific thresholds), acidosis, and the VAS dyspnea scale.â€¢ Stronger reliance on blood eosinophils to guide therapy:â€“ ICS only when â‰¥100 cells/ÂµLâ€“ Triple therapy mainly when â‰¥300 cells/ÂµLâ€“ For eos <100, azithromycin or roflumilast are preferred before escalating to triple therapy.â€¢ N-acetylcysteine gains a more relevant role during acute exacerbations, improving symptoms and inflammatory markers.â€¢ Introduction of the new concept of â€œdisease activityâ€, integrating inflammation, exacerbation burden and functional progression as therapeutic goals.â€¢ Biologic therapies, such as dupilumab, included for the first time in the treatment algorithm.â€¢ A new chapter on Artificial Intelligence and emerging technologies, addressing AI-supported diagnosis, image-based phenotyping, predictive models, and remote monitoring.â€¢ The diagnostic threshold FEV1/FVC < 0.70 is maintained, with no transition to LLN/z-score.A comprehensive update that reinforces personalized treatment and the integration of biomarkers, physiology, and advanced technologies in COPD care.These changes bring new challenges and opportunities. What do you believe will be the biggest barrier to implementing them in clinical practice?

texto: Acho que o â€œtextÃ£o do LinkedInâ€ chega para todo mundo,mas esse nÃ£o Ã© um texto de despedida (e espero que esse dia demore muito).Essa semana participei de um projeto muito legal, o DEV nas Escolas, da IXC, ministrando duas aulas de Banco de Dados para alunos do ensino mÃ©dio de escolas pÃºblicas. E enquanto explicava tabelas e chaves, me peguei pensando em como tudo comeÃ§ou.Quando entrei na IXC, em maio de 2021, eu vinha de um perÃ­odo bem difÃ­cil. Tinha acabado de desistir da psicologia, estava emocionalmente exausta e completamente perdida sobre quem eu queria ser. SÃ³ havia uma faÃ­sca: a curiosidade por tecnologia, misturada com o medo de nÃ£o ser capaz.Mas meus olhos brilharam quando entendi o universo da IXC. Mesmo pequena na Ã©poca, para mim parecia um mundo cheio de possibilidades, e eu finalmente senti que podia pertencer a algo.Comecei no Suporte Financeiro, comGabrielli Selleri, carinhosamente chamada por mim de Gabizinha, que me acolheu com uma paciÃªncia quase terapÃªutica. Ela foi minha primeira referÃªncia de lideranÃ§a: acolhedora, paciente e humana.Foi ali que aprendi a analisar com cuidado, investigar cada detalhe e confiar no meu raciocÃ­nio. Foi ali tambÃ©m que comecei a me transformar em analista, mesmo sem perceber.Depois fui para a DocumentaÃ§Ã£o TÃ©cnica, onde descobri meu gosto por ensinar, orientar e aprender com as pessoas,e onde a minha afinidade por bancos de dados comeÃ§ou a ganhar forma.Mais tarde, surgiu uma vaga rarÃ­ssima para o time de Banco de Dados.Eu nÃ£o sabia de quase nada.Me inscrevi com 0,5% de conhecimento e 99% de coragem.E eu passei.Entrei em uma equipe totalmente masculina, e tive a honra de ser a primeira mulher do time. Nada foi simples, mas oGuilherme Gabriel Kempka CervinieJaci Junior Turazzime ensinaram com paciÃªncia, me deram seguranÃ§a e me mostraram que, no fim das contas, alÃ©m da tÃ©cnica, o que sustenta o nosso trabalho Ã© o controle emocional e a capacidade de continuar aprendendo.Foi tambÃ©m ali que entendi algo fundamental:eu nasci para trabalhar com pessoas.Por mais que eu ame a parte tÃ©cnica e o raciocÃ­nio analÃ­tico, meu brilho vem de ensinar, ouvir, orientar, ajudar e construir soluÃ§Ãµes junto com o outro.Aprendi que gentileza nunca Ã© demais.Que explicaÃ§Ãµes pacientes podem mudar o dia de alguÃ©m.Que cinco minutos de escuta sincera valem mais que muita planilha.E foi assim que a menina tÃ­mida, que morria de medo de apresentar qualquer coisa, terminou essa semana ministrando duas aulas de Banco de Dados para adolescentes.Saio dessa experiÃªncia com o coraÃ§Ã£o quentinho, grata por cada pessoa, cada oportunidade, cada medo que me impulsionou e cada porta que se abriu no momento certo.Ainda tenho muito a evoluir. E isso Ã© o mais bonito da tecnologia: ela nunca para â€” e nÃ³s tambÃ©m nÃ£o.â€œTecnologia transforma processos. Pessoas transformam realidades.â€
